features: REAL NON STICK FRYING PAN: imarku frying pan can easily keep long-lasting nonstick while continuing the durability of the cast iron pan, maintaining even heat distribution and excellent heat retention. Also, it has an original thin-walled and thick-bottomed design which make you can experience the convenience of a lighter pan than a traditional cast iron skillet.

HONEYCOMB NONSTICK SURFACE: You can easily use imarku 8 inch frying pan to fry eggs or other delicious food. Our non stick frying pans adopt honeycomb nonstick technology that can effectively prevent food from sticking. The inner surface of the pan is etched with a precise concave-convex texture to ensure an even distribution of oil droplets. This help reduces fat and calorie intake.

UPGRADED NONSTICK FRYING PAN: In addition to superb nonstick performance, the nonstick pan is scratch-proof, rust-proof, and can heat up quickly and evenly for delicious frying results. Super easy to clean, Simply rinse with water and mild detergent to rinse off quickly after you're done cooking.

ERGONOMIC HANDLE: The hanging hole design made the skillet easy to hang up and convenient for saving kitchen space. The stainless steel handle of the non stick pan is double riveted for stability, comfortable grip, stylish, durable and secure. Stays cool on the stovetop so no need to worry about burns.

HIGH COMPATIBILITY AND VERSATILITY: imarku frying pan Work on all cooktops including Halogen Stoves, Oven, Gas, Ceramic and Induction. Meet multiple cooking needs, including deep-frying, boiling, stirring and grilling.

TRUSTWORTHY: imarku is dedicated to enhancing your user experience. We provide a free return within 3 months and a free exchange within 1 year if you encounter any problems with the product. Our professional 8 inch non stick skillet comes with an exquisite package that makes a perfect gift.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This pan is legit! Seriously, the best pan ever! If you’re looking for a true nonstick/non-scratch pan, this is the one for you. It looks and feels very much like a cast-iron, heavy too.… Evenly cooks and absolutely no stick! Even with eggs, that’s right; even with eggs!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I use this pan for everything! I bought one for a friend as a gift and then couldn’t help but purchase one for myself after hearing how great it was for them!Cooks evenly, earns very fast and clean up is extremely easy! I hardly have any stickage, and with a tiny bit of olive oil spray (tiny tiny bit) absolute nothing will stick! Great product and it’s the only pan I use these days!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars FINALLY a true non-stick pan
reviews.reviewText: I've been searching for years for a good pan to make eggs, steaks and general purpose frying. I've tried copper pans, "diamond" infused pans, ceramic coated pans, and always got the same result - sticking and difficult cleaning. I've done research on the "Hexclad" line of pans, but they seem waaaaay too pricey. $160 for a frying pan? No thank you. So I came across this pan, and the reviews seemed favorable. The original price is supposedly $100, but got it on sale for $59. I was skeptical and had low expectations, but when I used it, it blew me away. Eggs did NOT stick. Steak cooked beautifully with great crust with minimal oil. Vegetables cooked perfectly. Then after the pan cools, all you have to do is wipe it with a paper towel and you're good to go for the next meal. I think the key is to follow the instructions to "season" the pan before using it for the first time. Put some high temperature oil (like any vegetable oil, but NOT olive oil) in the pan and put on low heat. Then evenly spread the oil over the whole pan while it's on low heat with a paper towel. In this way it is similar to a cast iron pan in the way you have to season the surface. However this pan is a fusion of cast iron and traditional non-stick pans, and thus has the best features of both. It is a bit heavier than traditional non-stick pans, but not as heavy as cast iron. After several meals prepared in this pan, it seems to be well built and sturdy and will be able to be used for a long time in the future. If you're looking for a great non-stick pan, your search is over. Get this pan especially if you see it on sale. You won't regret it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very sturdy, easy to cook with and easy clean up
reviews.reviewText: Heavy and sturdy, heats evenly and food just slides right off. Can clean even the messiest recipes with just hot water and a rag. My favorite pan by far! Have used it every day for a couple months and love it just as much as the day I got it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Nonstick I Have Used
reviews.reviewText: I've used these pans daily for two months now and continue to be impressed by the nonstick cooking surface. While I would say it is average at best for browning meat, it may be that I haven't completely learned the best heat and time required for the different meats. Don't get me wrong, it can brown meat fabulously but you may need to adjust your past ways.Browning meat aside, these are well built pans. They are considerably heavier than the nonstick pans you may have been using but much lighter than cast iron. They appear two be a cast iron bottom heat surface with a nonstick cooking surface seamlessly mated together. The handles appear to be solid - maybe aluminum - and are securely fastened by two hefty rivets.The cooking surface is very slippery which probably necessitates the dimpled surface. In fact, the nonstick is so slippery, you could simply wipe the skillet interior clean immediately after cooking (the warmth helps) and you wouldn't know you had just cooked in it.I can't speak for the durability, but after two months of daily use they still look like new. I do recommend highly these pans if your budget allows it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Heavy but very nice.
reviews.reviewText: Heat is even over whole pan, not just in middle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars NONSTICK & EASY TO CLEAN
reviews.reviewText: Still in the honeymoon phase with my 12-inch skillet after two days of use. Works flawlessly so far to perfectly prepare eggs and bacon to order. Clean-up requires only a quick rinse at the sink, a wipe with the kitchen towel, and the pan is spotless and ready for its next job. Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really like these skillets. They are a little heavy but manageable. They are nonstick as well. I don't have to use any oil when cooking meat. I've cooked pork chops and lamb chops so far and they came out great. They always stuck in my old ones. They're also really sharp looking. You do need to decrease cooking heat because they do heat up quickly. I hand wash mine because it's easier since nothing sticks to them.
